class.title: Prin Acct I
class.description: If enrolling in ACCT 2301, you must have access to the Internet, e-mail and Microsoft Office software (97 or later version), including Word and Excel. Final exam must be taken at an approved monitored testing site. The MANDATORY orientation is online and must be completed by July 11. To complete the orientation, go to http://ecampus.dcccd.edu and follow the login procedures to access the course. Use your seven-digit student I.D. number as both the username and password. For more information, contact Clarice McCoy at clariceMccoy@dcccd.edu or 972-860-4166.

course.title: Advanced Design
course.description: This course will focus on two- or three-dimensional projects in a special topics area.

class.title: Special Topics
class.description: This course will focus on two- or three-dimensional projects in a special topics area.

class.title: Advanced Painting I
class.description: This 11-day Painting Workshop includes two and a half days with the modern master painter John Walker, professor of Boston University graduate painting program. With his art lectures and individual/group painting critiques, students will explore new ways of seeing and thinking about painting.
class.alt-description: This 11-day Painting Workshop includes two and a half days with the modern master painter John Walker, professor of Boston University graduate painting program. With his art lectures and individual/group painting critiques, students will explore new ways of seeing and thinking about painting.

class.title: Advanced Printmaking I
class.description: An intensive, 11-day workshop in water-based screenprinting, taught by Don Taylor and Visiting Artist John Hitchcock, professor of printmaking, University of Wisconsin at Madison.

class.title: Biology for Science Majors II
class.alt-description: BIOL 1406 is the prerequisite for BIOL 1407.

class.title: Biol for Non-Science Majors I
class.description: Content includes biology in the modern world, DNA, genetics and the cell. The recommended on-campus orientation will be offered July 9 at 7:00 PM in Room K121. Online orientation is also available. Lectures, labs, most assignments, tests and quizzes are online, however, a midterm exam, lab practicals 1 and 2 and the final exam will be taken in the Testing Center or a pre- arranged alternate site.

class.description: The subject is Mexico: A Cultural Perspective. E-mail Adrien Cuellar-McGuire at Adrien@dcccd.edu. It is not possible to make a lateral transfer into other non-online sections. class.title: Composition II
class.description: This course will examine literature concerning civil disobedience and nonviolent social movements in the 20th century. Readings, lectures, films, guest speakers and audio-visual presentations will help students gain a deeper understanding of the need for non-violence in their daily lives.
class.alt-description: This course will examine literature concerning civil disobedience and nonviolent social movements in the 20th century. Readings, lectures, films, guest speakers and audio-visual presentations will help students gain a deeper understanding of the need for non-violence in their daily lives.

class.title: World Lit
class.description: This course will explore what it means to be human. As students 'travel' through time and cultures, they will gain a greater understanding of how they relate as individuals to the larger world community.
class.alt-description: This course will explore what it means to be human. As students 'travel' through time and cultures, they will gain a greater understanding of how they relate as individuals to the larger world community.

class.title: Earth Science
class.description: Class includes local field trips to sites such as Lake Lewisville, weather stations, a star- gazing site and a canoe trip. STUDENTS MUST HAVE TEXT AND LAB MANUAL FOR FIRST CLASS MEETING. TEXTBOOK INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE IN ROOM K253.

class.title: Hist Geology
class.description: This class includes a fossil collecting field trip on Saturday, July 21. STUDENTS MUST HAVE TEXT AND LAB MANUAL FOR FIRST CLASS MEETING. TEXTBOOK INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE IN ROOM K253.

class.title: Learning Framework
class.description: HDEV 1300-2001 will help students develop skills that will support their success in college. Topics include, but are not limited to: motivation and self-discipline, time management, effective communication, test taking skills, reading/writing techniques, note taking, and the development of critical thinking skills.

class.description: ITSC 1401 is online and requires access to the Internet and e-mail along with Microsoft Office 2003, Office XP (Office 2002) or Office 2000 software, including Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint. class.title: Beg Lifetime Sports Activities
class.description: The beginning self defense course utilizes the Northern and Southern styles of Shaolin-Kung-Fu method to teach basic self defense techniques. Both mental and physical aspects of the arts are stressed. Uniform required and will be discussed at first class.
class.alt-description: The beginning self defense course utilizes the Northern and Southern styles of Shaolin-Kung-Fu method to teach basic self defense techniques. Both mental and physical aspects of the arts are stressed. Uniform required and will be discussed at first class.

class.title: Int Lifetime Sports Activities
class.description: The intermediate self defense course utilizes the Northern and Southern styles of Shaolin-Kung-Fu method to teach advanced self defense techniques. Both mental and physical aspects of the arts are stressed. Uniform required and will be discussed at first class.
class.alt-description: The intermediate self defense course utilizes the Northern and Southern styles of Shaolin-Kung-Fu method to teach advanced self defense techniques. Both mental and physical aspects of the arts are stressed. Uniform required and will be discussed at first class.

class.title: Int Physical Fitness
class.description: It is highly recommended that a student complete PHED 1164 prior to enrollment in the intermediate physical fitness course. This course offers continuation of a total fitness package including physical fitness assessment with computer printout, weight training and wellness concepts.

class.title: Internet Part 1
class.description: POFI 1104-2201 is a six-session beginning Internet course using Microsoft Internet Explorer, with reference to SBC/Yahoo and AOL. This course will emphasize basic e-mail functions plus attachments, searches using Google and other search engines, addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups. You will learn to shop and purchase online and perform other activities of popular Web sites. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP.
class.alt-description: POFI 1104-2201 is a six-session beginning Internet course using Microsoft Internet Explorer, with reference to SBC/Yahoo and AOL. This course will emphasize basic e-mail functions plus attachments, searches using Google and other search engines, addressing Web pages, using instant messenger and discussion groups. You will learn to shop and purchase online and perform other activities of popular Web sites. Recommended prerequisite: Windows XP.
